{{also|Gehen}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|geh'n}} * {{l|de|gehn}} {{qualifier|dated in formal prose, but still common informally and poetically}} ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|ǵʰeh₁|ǵʰengʰ}} From {{inh|de|gmh|gān}}, {{m|gmh|gēn}}, from {{inh|de|goh|gān}}, {{m|goh|gēn}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*gāną}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*ǵʰeh₁-||to leave}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|gaan}}, {{cog|nds|gan}}, {{m|nds|gahn}}, {{cog|en|go}}, Swedish and Danish {{m|sv|gå}}. The form ''gēn'' instead of ''gān'' is of Bavarian origin, but many dialects of Central and Low German have ''-e-'' (from earlier ''-ei-'') or ''ei'' in the 2nd and 3rd person singular present, in keeping with the Proto-Germanic irregular conjugation. The ''-h-'' was introduced into the spelling by analogy with {{m|de|sehen}}, in which it had become mute but was retained in spelling. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈɡeːən/|[ˈɡeː.ən]}} {{a|official standard, but less common}} * {{IPA|de|/ɡeːn/|[ɡeːn]}} {{a|predominant}} * {{audio|de|De-gehen.ogg}} * {{a|Bavaria}} {{audio|de|Bar-gehen.ogg}} * {{rhymes|de|eːən|eːn}} * {{hyphenation|de|ge|hen}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=7|geht|ging|gegangen|past subjunctive=ginge|auxiliary=sein}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[go]], to [[walk]] # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[walk]] (some distance); to go (some distance) by foot # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[leave]] #: {{ux|de|Ich '''gehe''' jetzt.|t=I’m '''leaving''' now.|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[leave]], to [[take off]] {{gloss|airplane, train}} #: {{ux|de|Wann '''geht''' dein Zug?|When is your train '''leaving'''?}} # {{lb|de|impersonal|intransitive}} to be going; to be [[alright]]; {{non-gloss definition|indicates how the dative object fares}} #: {{ux|de|Wie '''geht''' es dir?|t=How are you doing?|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Es '''geht''' mir gut.|t=I’m doing well. (Literally, “It goes well for me.”)|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Es '''geht'''.|t=It’s alright.|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|slightly|informal|intransitive}} to be possible #: {{ux|de|Das würde vielleicht '''gehen'''.|t=That might '''be possible'''.|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|colloquial|intransitive}} to [[work]], to [[function]] {{gloss|of a machine, method or the like}} #: {{syn|de|funktionieren}} #: {{ux|de|Der Kaffeeautomat '''geht''' nicht.|t=The coffee dispenser doesn't '''work'''.|inline=1}} #* '''2014''', ''[[w:Der Spiegel|Der Spiegel]]'', issue [http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/index-2014-21.html 21/2014], page 62: #*: Aber erst in Beirut lernte sie, wie professionelles Kochen '''geht''', die Logistik, das Timing, die Organisation, um mehrere Hundert Mahlzeiten zuzubereiten. #*:: But not until Beirut she learned how professional cooking '''works''', the logistics, the timing, the organization for preparing several hundred meals. # {{lb|de|colloquial|intransitive}} to be in progress; to [[last]] #: {{ux|de|Die Sitzung '''geht''' bis ein Uhr.|t=The session '''is scheduled''' until one o’clock.|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|regional|or|dated|impersonal|intransitive|with ''[[auf]]'' followed by a time}} to [[approach]]; to be going (on some one) #: {{ux|de|Es '''geht''' auf 8 Uhr.|t=It’s '''going''' on 8 o’clock.|inline=1}} ====Usage notes==== Unlike English ''to go'', German ''gehen'' does not mean "to travel somewhere" in general. A distinction must be made between ''gehen'' (walk), {{m|de|fahren}} (go by bike, car, train, or ship), and {{m|de|fliegen}} (go by plane). If used with a place one cannot or would not commonly walk to, ''gehen'' often implies that one intends to stay there permanently, e.g.: ''Ich '''gehe''' nach New York.'' – I''''m going to live''' in New York. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|geh|ging|gegangen|s||||a}} '''Note:''' The 2nd person plural imperative can also be {{m|de|gehet}}, now in archaic or poetic style. ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|kommen}} * {{l|de|rennen}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |abgehen |angehen |aufgehen |ausgehen |begehen |drangehen |draufgehen |drübergehen |durchgehen |eingehen |entgehen |ergehen |fortgehen |fremdgehen |herabgehen |herausgehen |herumgehen |heruntergehen |hinabgehen |hinausgehen |hinaufgehen |hinuntergehen |hinübergehen |hingehen |hintergehen |losgehen |mitgehen |nachgehen |schlafengehen |sichergehen |spazierengehen |übergehen |umgehen |untergehen |vergehen |vorgehen |weitergehen |zergehen |zugehen |zurückgehen }} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|gehts}} ===See also=== * {{l|de|fahren}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:German suppletive verbs]]
